meanings.definition: A person who rouses or stirs up others.
meanings.sent1: The rousters in the crowd cheered loudly at the game.
meanings.sent2: The political leader was known as a skilled rousters of the masses.
meanings.sent3: The rousters at the party made sure everyone was having a good time.
meanings.sent4: Her speech acted as a rousters, awakening the audience to the issues at hand.
meanings.sent5: The rousters in the play were always ready to motivate the team.

meanings.sent1: She rousters her friends to go on an adventure.
meanings.sent2: The coach rousters the team before every game to boost their morale.
meanings.sent3: The smell of fresh coffee rousters him from his sleep every morning.
meanings.sent4: His passionate speech rousters the audience to take action.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm rousters the leaves, making them dance in the wind.
